intro: Reineckea yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan reineckea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to its challenging environment. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female structures, and it relies on specific pollinators for reproduction. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Reineckea yunnanensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
